post.body: tried searching "chemicals" tweets http://tinyurl.com/7k7hwd
my friend here in japan to twitter
I may invite my friends on twitter but I wonder if they find it interesting to tweet in english...
btw thanks @jeanlucr for introducing @twitartists. seems interesting :)
OK I'd be better start with summarizing those well-known aspects. then I'd be able to spread my idea.
emission of chemicals (esp known as ghgs) affects environment and may cause climate change...
relation between climate change and chemicals management - both have many things to do with environment...
to write something about chemicals management, especially interesting for business people... that's what I have to do now but I have no idea
I'm not yet sure of EU-REACH way... do I have to start with it?
Ah I forgot I wanted to look for some free wiki services. I use Wikispaces in Japanese and I have to look for another one for English use.
that's what I have to start with now... in this very end of the year >_<
well, about the offer of writing book... I was too lazy with gathering references and grounds on my opinion.
seems I have to check his books - James Lovelock http://tinyurl.com/oplhj
morning. being hungry. feeling a little anxiety on today's phone-call meeting. anyway, it's a new start for me ^^
gonna go out for jogging.
seems I must keep seeking for more interesting people on twitter :D
I'm following just few people and it matters. That's why I haven't met with cultures I don't know yet.
Anyway, I'm home! lol
I've never met tweets saying "I'm home" and "Welcome back" in English while I see Japanese twitter-ers give those ones each other.
very sleepy though I have to wait and prepare for phonecall!!
